page.title: 09LLANGURIG, FARMING
page.content: Most farms in the block are small. Only a few are over 100 acres. Livestock: Sheep by far outnumber any other livestock. They are sold as breeding ewes to lowland farms, as fat lambs or store lambs. The breeds are various, but mainly cross-bred. Cattle are kept by some farmers. These are mainly suckling cows and young stores. A minority are fattened for killing locally. Horses are bred by a few farmers as a sideline. These are for showing or selling as riding ponies. Only one farmer is engaged in large-scale calf rearing. Silage production is on the increase. It suits the climate. High rainfall requires regular applications of lime. Shearing, silage and hay making is often done by contractors.
